Coffee filters can be used as seed starters, as they can be filled with soil and placed in a shallow tray, allowing for easy transplantation of seedlings into larger pots.
Coffee filters can be used as a natural air freshener, as they can be filled with baking soda and used to absorb odors in the fridge or car.
Coffee filters can be used as a natural insect repellent, as they can be filled with herbs like lavender or eucalyptus and hung around the garden or patio.
Coffee filters can be used as a natural plant fertilizer, as they can be soaked in a diluted solution of fertilizer and used to water plants.
Coffee filters can be used as a natural mold preventer, as they can be placed in the bottom of a container or mold to prevent the growth of mold.
